oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James N. Watkins, 1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Watkins, writing to his sister, is getting impatient about how little correspondence he receives. Fears that some have concluded he is "not worth writing to." The regiment has not been paid since it returned to camp. According to Gov. Kirkwood (Iowa), the recruits who entered service in 1862 would be mustered our at "experation of the Regiment." Officers say they cannot hold those men. Watkins born in Sciota, Ohio, 1845. He served in Co. G, 2nd Iowa Inf. Regt., USA.
